contextId.information: These are Hebrew women's names. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is Reuel's daughter. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of Moses's wife. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Etham is located south of the route heading towards the Philistines, at the border of the wilderness. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are towns on Egypt's eastern border. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Miriam was the older sister of Moses and Aaron. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is an oasis in the desert, a place with water and shade trees. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
a place in the desert whose name means "testing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This was the name of a place in the desert. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is a son of Moses and Zipporah, whose name means "God is the one who helps me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

This is an area on the edge of the wilderness of Sinai where the people of Israel had been camping. See how you translated this name in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:17:01|17:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are men's names. See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:06:23|6:23]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are men's names. See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:06:23|6:23]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Hur was a man who was a friend of Moses and Aaron. See how you translated this name in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:17:08|17:10]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"Oholiab" and "Ahisamach" are names of men. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:31:06|31:6]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
contextId.quote: Oholiab son of Ahisamach, from the tribe of Dan

contextId.quote: Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur
